security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation in SKILL.md with pytest examples and TDD methodology instructions. All static findings are false positives from code examples in markdown backticks. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem operations exist in the skill.

content.user_title: Write Python Tests Using TDD and Pytest
content.value_statement: Writing tests first helps catch bugs early and improves code design. This skill guides you through test-driven development cycles with pytest, from writing failing tests to achieving green coverage.
actual_capabilities: Guide Red-Green-Refactor TDD workflow for Python projects
Generate pytest test files with fixtures and parametrization
Configure pytest settings in pyproject.toml files
Audit existing test suites for quality and coverage gaps
Create test reports in TESTING_REPORT.local.md format
Provide pytest command examples for coverage analysis
limitations: Does not execute tests directly, relies on Claude Code tools
Requires pytest and dependencies already installed in environment
Cannot modify production code automatically without user approval
Focuses on pytest framework, not unittest or other test tools

use_cases.title: Audit test suite quality

use_cases.title: Configure CI test pipelines
use_cases.description: Set up pytest configuration and generate structured test reports for continuous integration workflows.

output: mock_db_connection: Returns MagicMock with session scope
sample_user_data: Provides test user dict with function scope

best_practices: Always write the failing test first before implementing functionality (RED phase)
Keep each test focused on a single behavior or assertion to maintain clarity
Use pytest fixtures with appropriate scopes to share setup logic across tests
anti_patterns: Writing implementation code before seeing the test fail for the right reason
Creating tests that depend on execution order or shared mutable state
Skipping edge cases and error conditions when writing test scenarios

faq.question: Does this skill install pytest automatically?
faq.answer: No. You must have pytest installed. Use uv add pytest or pip install pytest before using this skill.

faq.question: Can I use this with Django or FastAPI projects?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides pytest guidance applicable to any Python framework. Configure framework-specific plugins in pyproject.toml.

faq.question: How does this differ from writing tests without TDD?
faq.answer: TDD requires writing failing tests first, which improves design and ensures tests actually validate behavior instead of passing incorrectly.

faq.question: Will this skill modify my source code?
faq.answer: The skill guides test writing but does not automatically modify code. All changes require your review through Claude Code interface.

faq.question: Can I run tests in parallel with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides guidance on using pytest-xdist plugin with -n auto flag for parallel test execution.

faq.question: What if my tests keep failing?
faq.answer: Check pytest output for the specific assertion failure. Common issues: wrong expected values, missing imports, or incorrect test setup.
